main event: Ground observers reported an unidentified object hovering at about 5,000 feet between Valley Forge and Coatesville, Pennsylvania on February 12, 1957.
interesting points: The sighting lasted for 18 minutes until the observer lost sight of the object., The object was described as resembling a bright silver steel ball approximately 2-3 feet in diameter., It emitted a very bright golden light that illuminated the surrounding area., No human faces were visible in the accompanying black and white photograph., Multiple conclusions were drawn about the object, including it possibly being a balloon or aircraft, but it remained unidentified.
sighted object: unidentified object resembling a bright silver steel ball
location: Between Valley Forge and Coatesville, Pennsylvania, USA
witness description: Anita M. Stewart, a guard for Lukens Steel
